Tasks.Name: Understanding Cloud Concepts
Tasks.Description: Get a grasp of fundamental cloud computing concepts, including the benefits, different cloud models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS), and common cloud service providers.
Steps: Create an AWS Free Tier account
Complete the Coursera course on Cloud Computing
Watch introductory YouTube videos on cloud computing
Read the AWS documentation to familiarize yourself with basic cloud concepts

Tasks.Name: Introduction to AWS
Tasks.Description: Learn about AWS's key services, its architecture, and how it compares to other cloud providers.
Steps: Read AWS whitepapers on cloud computing
Review AWS FAQs for common questions and answers
Explore AWS website tutorials
Complete the Udemy course on AWS Essentials for a comprehensive overview

Tasks.Name: AWS Console Navigation
Tasks.Description: Familiarize yourself with the AWS Management Console, its main components, and how to navigate within it.
Steps: Explore the AWS Management Console
Read AWS documentation on the console interface
Follow tutorials on how to navigate and use the console

Tasks.Name: AWS Security Basics
Tasks.Description: Learn about fundamental security principles in the cloud, including IAM roles, access control, and data encryption.
Steps: Explore AWS Security Hub for security insights
Read the AWS documentation on security best practices
Understand basic IAM concepts

Tasks.Name: EC2 Instance Management
Tasks.Description: Learn about Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) and how to launch, manage, and configure virtual machines.
Steps: Read the AWS EC2 documentation
Follow tutorials on launching and managing EC2 instances
Complete hands-on labs for practical experience

Tasks.Name: Storage with S3
Tasks.Description: Learn about Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) and its use cases for storing objects, data, and files.
Steps: Read the AWS S3 documentation
Complete the Udemy course on AWS S3
Follow tutorials on using S3 for storage

Tasks.Name: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
Tasks.Description: Learn how to use IAM to manage user permissions, roles, and access control in AWS.
Steps: Read the AWS IAM documentation
Follow tutorials on setting up IAM users and roles

Tasks.Name: Networking with VPC
Tasks.Description: Learn about Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) and how to create, configure, and manage virtual networks in AWS.
Steps: Read the AWS VPC documentation
Follow tutorials on creating and managing VPCs
Set up a basic VPC for practice

Tasks.Name: Serverless Computing with Lambda
Tasks.Description: Learn how to develop and deploy serverless applications using AWS Lambda.
Steps: Read the AWS Lambda documentation
Complete the Udemy course on AWS Lambda
Explore the AWS SAM framework
Build a simple serverless application using Lambda

Tasks.Name: Database Management with DynamoDB
Tasks.Description: Learn about Amazon DynamoDB and how to use it for NoSQL database management in AWS.
Steps: Read the AWS DynamoDB documentation
Follow tutorials on using DynamoDB
Complete the Udemy course on DynamoDB

Tasks.Name: API Gateway and API Development
Tasks.Description: Learn how to use AWS API Gateway to create and manage APIs in AWS.
Steps: Read the AWS API Gateway documentation
Follow tutorials on creating and deploying APIs with API Gateway
Complete the Udemy course on API Gateway

Tasks.Name: AWS CloudWatch Monitoring
Tasks.Description: Learn about AWS CloudWatch and how to monitor your AWS resources, applications, and services.
Steps: Read the AWS CloudWatch documentation
Follow tutorials on using CloudWatch for monitoring

Tasks.Name: Security Best Practices
Tasks.Description: Dive deeper into security considerations in AWS, including IAM policies, access control, and data encryption techniques.
Steps: Explore AWS Security Hub for security insights
Complete the Udemy course on AWS Security
Read the AWS documentation on security best practices
Implement security best practices in a sample AWS environment

Tasks.Name: Deployment and Automation with CloudFormation
Tasks.Description: Learn about AWS CloudFormation and how to use it to automate deployments and infrastructure provisioning.
Steps: Read the AWS CloudFormation documentation
Follow tutorials on using CloudFormation
Complete the Udemy course on CloudFormation
Create and deploy simple CloudFormation templates

Tasks.Name: AWS DevOps and CI/CD
Tasks.Description: Learn about AWS DevOps principles and tools like CodePipeline for continuous integration and continuous delivery.
Steps: Read the AWS CodePipeline documentation
Follow AWS DevOps blog articles
Explore tutorials on CI/CD in AWS

Tasks.Name: AWS Cost Optimization
Tasks.Description: Learn about AWS cost management strategies and tools for optimizing your cloud spending.
Steps: Explore AWS Cost Explorer for cost analysis
Learn about AWS Budgets for setting cost limits
Read the AWS pricing documentation

Stages.Name: Week 5: AWS Services for Web Development

Tasks.Name: S3 Website Hosting
Tasks.Description: Learn how to host static websites using Amazon S3.
Steps: Read the AWS S3 documentation on website hosting
Follow tutorials on deploying static websites to S3

Tasks.Name: AWS Amplify for Web Development
Tasks.Description: Learn about AWS Amplify and its capabilities for building and deploying web applications in AWS.
Steps: Read the AWS Amplify documentation
Follow tutorials on using Amplify for web development
Complete the Udemy course on AWS Amplify

Tasks.Name: API Integration with AWS Services
Tasks.Description: Learn how to integrate your web applications with AWS services like Lambda and DynamoDB.
Resources: Tutorials on API Integration with AWS
Steps: Read the AWS documentation on API integration
Follow tutorials on integrating APIs with AWS services

Tasks.Name: AWS CloudFront for Content Delivery
Tasks.Description: Learn about AWS CloudFront and its role in delivering content faster to users globally.
Steps: Read the AWS CloudFront documentation
Follow tutorials on using CloudFront for content delivery

Tasks.Name: AWS Networking
Tasks.Description: Explore advanced networking concepts in AWS, including VPC peering, NAT gateways, and load balancing.
Steps: Read the AWS VPC documentation on advanced networking
Follow tutorials on VPC peering, NAT gateways, and load balancing

Tasks.Name: AWS Security Auditing and Compliance
Tasks.Description: Learn about AWS security auditing tools and how to ensure compliance with industry standards.
Resources: Udemy Course on AWS Security Auditing
Steps: Explore AWS Security Hub for security audits
Review AWS compliance documentation
Complete the Udemy course on AWS security auditing

Tasks.Name: AWS Serverless Architecture Patterns
Tasks.Description: Learn about different architectural patterns for building serverless applications in AWS.
Steps: Read AWS serverless architecture blog posts
Follow tutorials on serverless patterns
Complete the Udemy course on serverless architecture

Tasks.Name: AWS Cost Management and Optimization
Tasks.Description: Dive deeper into AWS cost management strategies and tools to optimize your cloud spending efficiently.
Steps: Explore AWS Cost Explorer for detailed cost analysis
Learn about AWS Budgets for setting cost alerts and limits
Read the AWS pricing documentation for optimizing resource usage

Tasks.Name: AWS Cloud Practitioner Essentials
Tasks.Description: Prepare for the AWS Cloud Practitioner Essentials certification exam, which covers the fundamental concepts of AWS.
Resources: Udemy Course on AWS Cloud Practitioner
Steps: Read the AWS Cloud Practitioner Exam Guide
Complete the Udemy course on AWS Cloud Practitioner
Take practice exams to assess your knowledge

Tasks.Name: AWS Solutions Architect - Associate Preparation
Tasks.Description: If you want to pursue a more advanced certification, start preparing for the AWS Solutions Architect - Associate exam.
Resources: Udemy Course on AWS Solutions Architect - Associate
Steps: Read the AWS Solutions Architect - Associate Exam Guide
Complete the Udemy course on AWS Solutions Architect - Associate
Take practice exams to evaluate your readiness

Tasks.Name: Build a Simple Web Application on AWS
Tasks.Description: Apply your AWS knowledge to build a real-world web application, leveraging services like EC2, S3, Lambda, and DynamoDB.
Resources: Tutorials on Web Application Development with AWS
Steps: Choose a simple web application idea
Plan and design the architecture using AWS services
Implement the web application using your AWS skills
Deploy and test the application in AWS

Tasks.Name: Contribute to Open Source Projects on AWS
Tasks.Description: Gain practical experience by contributing to open-source projects that utilize AWS.
Steps: Explore AWS open-source projects on GitHub
Join relevant AWS communities
Contribute to open-source projects by fixing bugs or adding features
